result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael G. Bohman was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: $3,460.80 Payable to Jefferey R Weber and $1,335.97 payable to Crime Victim Compensation Program
Counseling as deemed necessary by agent.   DNA sample unless already done. No contact w/ JRW(victim), AW(wife of victim) their children or the residence.

timeConds.notes: w/huber on or before May 1, 2017 at 9:00 am.  An additional 60 days are imposed and stayed for rule violations

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Michael G. Bohman

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Exhibit #1 scanned and physcially retained by CoC

records.descr: Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt: Exhibit #1 marked(letter from Quast Consulting & Testing) offered and received.

Defendant Michael G. Bohman in court with attorney James Charles Koppelman.  Kurt Byron Zengler appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case called appearances given at 9:05 am.  Court address the deft as to what occurred at the hearing in October.  Court addresses the Defense attorney as to what occurred at the last hearing.  Court directs the clerk to enter the plea of no contest(was taken in October)  Court reviews the rights of the deft.

Court to hear arguements as to restitution.  State calls the victim(JRW) to testify.   JRW duly sworn and testifies.  Court grants the restitution to the victim in the amont $3,460.80(120 hrs X 28.84) and Crime Victim Compensation in the amount of $1,335.97

Court takes a recess at 10:09 am to take care of the 10:00 am hearing.  Back on the record at 10:35 am.

Court orders:
12 months probation w/held
  Court Costs and any applicable assessments, fees and surcharges due the court.
  90 days jail w/huber on or before STAYING 60 for rule violation  will not have to start till after May 1st, 2017 and can be brought back if a concern that this can not be done in crements to be brought  to the courtn
  No contact w/victim JRW or his wife AW or the children of JRW or AW or their residence.
  Counseling as deemed necessary by agent.
  DNA sample unless already done.
 Restitution payable to Crime Victim Compensation $1,335.97; Victim for lost wages $3,460.80 - payment at a rate set by the agent

2 days sentence credit

Defendant Michael G. Bohman in court with attorney James Charles Koppelman.  Kurt Byron Zengler appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case called appearances given.  Will need a restitution hearing will need to scheduled at a later date.  Count 1 is amended to 940.19(1) Battery - Misd.  Deft enters a plea of no contest to the amended charge.   Plea questionnaire reviewed. Clerk directed to enter plea. Factual basis. Court accepts pleas & finds guilty.  Court decides to do the sentencing at a later date with the restitution hearing.  Restitution already set for 11-4-16 for one hour.
Restitution hearing on November 4, 2016 at 09:00 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on October 6, 2016 at 02:30 pm.
Jury trial on August 22, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Michael G. Bohman in court with attorney James Charles Koppelman.  Kurt Byron Zengler appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case called appearances given. Matthew Waid  duly sworn and testifies.  Id'd deft.  Court rules that probable cause exists  Pre-trial/scheduling conference scheduled for February 25, 2016 at 08:40 am.

Defendant Michael G. Bohman in court, in custody with attorney James C. Koppelman(special appear).  Kurt Byron Zengler appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Reading of the complaint waived.  Time limits for the preliminary hearing are waived.  Bond set  Scheduling conference scheduled for December 17, 2015 at 08:00 am.
